intro: Lastrea schiedeana, commonly known as the Schiede's lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, adding ornamental value. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in rock gardens and succulent collections.
